body.name: Bambo Nature Overnight Baby Diapers (Sizes 3 TO 6), Size 5, 88 Count
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 15 hrs 51 mins
features: Size 5 fits baby weight range 27-40 lbs. See size chart for more details.

THE BEST COMFORT FIT FOR BABY - our diapers feature a flexible waistband and latex-free leg cuffs that provide an extra leakage barrier designed to stay in place throughout the entire night, even when baby moves around.

SUPERNATURALLY EFFECTIVE - our unique Channel Technology and super-absorbent core can stand up to multiple wettings all night long. Combined with our fully breathable backsheet, baby's sensitive skin will stay dry and comfortable which means a better sleep for the whole family.
THE BEST FOR OUR PLANET - made from 100% wind power and the first baby diapers certified with the Nordic Swan Ecolabel.
SKIN SAFE MATERIALS - free of harmful chemicals and all known allergens and the fluff pulp is made TCF (totally chlorine-free).
body.description: Bambo Nature’s Overnight Diapers are specifically designed for nighttime use. Our unique Channel Technology is meant to absorb large volumes of liquid incredibly fast so that your baby can stay dry and comfortable all night long! Our superior disposable overnight diapers are eco-friendly, certified skin-safe, free of harmful chemicals and all known allergens - making them perfect for baby’s sensitive skin. The flexible latex-free leg cuffs and waistband provide an extra leakage barrier designed to stay in place throughout the entire night, even when your baby moves around in their sleep. A premium overnight diaper means more Zzz’s for the whole family!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 2 years and going strong | Bambo Nature Overnight Eco-Friendly Baby Diapers, Size 5
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this pack of diapers through the Vine program but I've been a loyal Bambo user for two-plus years and going strong. These are my absolute favorite diapers on the market! Tight velcro-style hold grips securely and keeps diaper in place, snug and secure. Leg ruffles hold in any blowouts and inner core is absorbent without having any problems staying together 99% of the time. We've had maybe 10 diapers fall apart or leak over the course of hundreds of packs used, even through toddler poops, long overnight sleeps, even when the kids had a brush with norovirus. Best of all, they're ecologically friendly and decompose much quicker than traditional diapers, so I don't feel nearly as guilty about using all of the disposables this way.If your'e on the fence about choosing bamboo diapers and wondering if they work as well as traditionals, I really invite you to give these a try! I'm super satisfied with the performance of these diapers from newborn into toddler phase, and when my next kiddo comes along I feel certain I'll be back to start all over again. Recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Game Changer for Overnight
reviews.reviewText: I have been using Bambo Nature Diapers for over 5 years now for our two kids and have a closet full for the one on the way. My son never had an issue overnight but my daughter was having some leaking if she happened to also have a bowel movement overnight (she’s 3 and special needs). I ordered these when they ran a sale at first and I kid you not in the few months we have been using them she has not had one blowout! I was having to get her right in the bath, strip her bedsheets, and even lost a few pairs of little sleepies Jammie’s. These overnight versions are an absolute must now for her - I was skeptical since she was already in the Dream ones overnight but they are legitimately different. #sweepstakes

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good diapers, better for the environment
reviews.reviewText: Often, environmentally friendly versions of common products don't quite stack up to the less friendly versions. For me, it's all about figuring out if the balance is worth it for the eco-benefits. In this case, I would say the benefits of using eco-friendly diapers outweighs the drawbacks, and these products are good (just maybe not quite as good as the common diaper brands).My particular use of these is for my three year old who is potty trained but still wears diapers overnight to avoid any accidents. These are pretty good at absorbing overnight pee, but if he sleeps longer than about 10 hours (which can occasionally happen), there can be some leakage. Comfort-wise, I'm relying on my son's account. He says they're fine. He doesn't really notice much of a difference between these and others he's used, but I'm pretty sure he's not thinking deeply about the comfort of the diapers he's using. However, he would complain if there were an issue, so I guess there isn't one. They do feel noticeably slightly less soft than other brands, but that's likely due to the eco-friendly processes and ingredients. It's also nice to know that even the packaging they come in is paper and recyclable or compostable.Bottom line: They're priced similarly if slightly more expensive than common grocery store brands of diapers, and they're almost as good in terms of functionality. The eco-benefits should be enough for many parents to consider using these. They may not be as good for the environment as cloth diapers, but they offer most of the conveniences of regular diapers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars These work overnight!
reviews.reviewText: My baby has always needed overnight diapers. Regular diapers do not work for us - we have woken up soaked in pee too many nights. Very pleased to say that these Bambo Nature overnight diapers work well. Absolutely NO leaks by morning. My little one is an active sleeper - tosses, turns, and sits straight up in the middle of the night. In the morning, the diaper was full, as expected, but no leaks at the stomach or leg openings.These are soft inside and out, although I would not say more than other brands. The back waistband is not that flexible, but the sides are very flexible.I particularly like that these have no fragrances, phthalates, parabens, lotions, preservatives. Great for my little one's sensitive skin.Overall these are great diapers and worked well!"MATERIALS: Textile backsheet (outer side) of poly-propylene (PP) and polyethylene (PE). Absorbent of polyacrylate (SAP) and cellulose (TCF fiuff). Inner side of nonwoven (PP). Acquisition layer of nonwoven (PET/CO-PET). Hook-and-loop fastening of nonwoven (PP/PE). Glue made of synthetic rubber no optical brightener added. Elastication made from elastane. No perfumes or moisturizing lotions have been used in the product. Non-toxic water-based ink has been used on the outer side for design purposes."Made in Denmark

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Bambo Nature Overnight Diapers
reviews.reviewText: Maybe it was just our son, maybe it’s the quality of these diapers, but they simply didn’t work for us. They seem to be less absorbent than other regular diapers and we had more leaks with them too. They also seem to run a little smaller than other brands. They work okay if the environmentally friendly aspect is that important to you- I think as a brand they do a lot better job at that than others. If it isn’t your top priority, I think there are better options.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Update 12/29/21 These work as well as Pampers Swaddlers Overnights
reviews.reviewText: Bambo Nature Overnight Eco-Friendly Baby Diapers, Size 5, White, 88 CountUpdate 12/29/21My daughter said these work as well as the Pampers Swaddlers Overnights. She is happy with these diapers, which makes me happy with this order. I highly recommend.Original ReviewI ordered these for my 2 1/2 year old grandson. He is just under 30 lbs. He sleeps 12 hours or more at night. I don’t know if these will hold up to that. My daughter has been using Pampers Swaddlers Overnights with great success but they are 10¢ more per diaper.I will update this review, after I hear back from my daughter about the performance of these diapers.At the time I ordered these diapers, they were competitively priced at 58¢ each.🤗 Thank you so much for taking the time to read this review, have a FANTASTIC day!!😊5★

I’ve used both the dream and overnights off & on for the last 18m. All of a sudden with this last box of Overnights, we’ve had a leak every single night. Every night. I even wake baby before I go to bed to change (3 hours after babys been sleeping) and they can’t make 6 hours without baby being soaked. Very disappointing.

reviews.reviewText: Since using this nappy for my 20 month old, she has developed a nasty rash, the nappy gets very hard when it’s wet and it’s uncomfortable and I would definitely not buy anymore and would have to give it all away as I purchased a box. Waste of money
